result.execSummary:
The defendant Tameka R Redic was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Order for Payment and Reimbursement to County

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  9:32 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Natalie Zibolski. 
Defendant appears by zoom audio (Court approved) with Atty Jessica Phelps in person. 

Date and time set for plea/sentencing; VRCW. 
COURT notes waiver of personal appearance filed; Court performs colloquy; defendant waives right to appear in person. 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

PLEA to Count 1 (Disorderly Conduct/Domestic Abuse)>>NO CONTEST.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS:  $50.00 fine plus court costs including DNA sample/surcharge and Domestic Abuse surcharge. 

Adj:  9:41 a.m.

Jury Trial on November 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
